text: The Territory of New Mexico was an organized incorporated territory of the United States that existed (with varying boundaries) from September 9, 1850, until January 6, 1912, when the remaining extent of the territory was admitted to the Union as the State of New Mexico, making it the longest-lived organized incorporated territory of the United States, lasting approximately 62 years. == References == *David L. Caffey, Chasing the Santa Fe Ring: Power and Privilege in Territorial New Mexico. Albuquerque, NM: University of New Mexico Press, 2014. Category:1850 establishments in the United States Category:1850s establishments in New Mexico Territory Category:1910s disestablishments in the United States Category:1912 disestablishments Category:Former territories of the United States Category:History of Arizona Category:History of Colorado Category:History of Nevada Category:History of New Mexico
title: New Mexico Territory
